title: The German stock exchange creates infrastructure for cryptocurrencies
body:
Börse Stuttgart, which is the second largest stock exchange in Germany, creates a complete infrastructure for digital resources - especially for digital currencies,  reports bithub.pl. The company has published a statement in which it announces that after the commencement of trading in cryptocurrencies through the Bison application, the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) platform will soon be created.

Cryptocurrencies have become the main development goal of the company because it intends to continue the digitization strategy in order to eventually become a pioneer of the digital transformation of financial markets and financial products.

\- In the trading system of tokens, through our ICO platform, you can trade on the secondary market. This is an important factor for success for ICO. At the same time, we are able to respond to the demand from both retail and institutional investors in order to obtain regulation and credibility of the environment for trading cryptocurrencies, "said Alexander Höptner, a spokesman for Börse Stuttgart.
gallery: This development of exchange services connected with cryptocurrencies and digital resources is another step after the stock exchange announced its application in April this year - Bison. This direct competition for the leading Robinhood trading app is to be launched in autumn this year and initially it will support the trade of Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple and Litecoin.
